page.title: 19RICHMOND GREEN
page.content: {Richmond Green}is situated just off the town centre. It is used for cricket matches in the summer as well as the annual Richmond May Fair. Around the green are several notable buildings including the gateway to {Richmond Palace.}An earlier palace was burnt down in 1499, and the gateway is all that remains of the palace built on the same site by Henry VII. It was Henry VII who was responsible for changing the name of the village from the Anglo-Saxon "Shene" meaning "shining place" to Richmond after his Yorkshire home.{Richmond Theatre}"the theatre on the green" was designed by Frank Matcham and opened in 1899. It still presents a full programme, including many plays before they open in the West End. Houses around the green are highly sought after and fetch a high price.
